title: RIOT ADMINS_ I got a good one for you. I can not Play, Download, or View any part of the support pg.
body:
I am not having any problems with ANY other web-sights, but this one. For some reason i had a problem connecting to the server. So I uninstalled it. I get on the Download Page click the button to re-install it 

The Steps i did are in Bold and Italicized the normal text is the errors

***and i get the whole:***

 "This webpage is not available" 

Google Chrome could not load the webpage because l3cdn.riotgames.com took too long to respond. The website may be down, or you may be experiencing issues with your Internet connection.
Go to http://riotgames.com/

Error code: ERR_CONNECTION_TIMED_OUT

***Then i am like alright i will check everything on my side and call my internet provider.***

***They try a few things, but nothing worked. They say that because every other site that I try works then it is not a problem from my side nor their side. They said i need to report this to League of Legends.***

***I go to submit a ticket and i get this:***

 "This webpage is not available" 

Google Chrome could not load the webpage because support.riotgames.com took too long to respond. The website may be down, or you may be experiencing issues with your Internet connection.
Check your Internet connection
Check any cables and reboot any routers, modems, or other network devices you may be using.
Allow Chrome to access the network in your firewall or antivirus settings.
If it is already listed as a program allowed to access the network, try removing it from the list and adding it again.
If you use a proxy server...
Check your proxy settings or contact your network administrator to make sure the proxy server is working. If you don't believe you should be using a proxy server: Go to the Chrome menu > Settings > Show advanced settings... > Change proxy settings... > LAN Settings and deselect "Use a proxy server for your LAN".
Error code: ERR_CONNECTION_TIMED_OUT

***Then I go to Help & Support i read the guildlines about creating a discussion and it says i need to support a ticket
 so i click on it and i get this:***

Google Chrome could not load the webpage because support.riotgames.com took too long to respond. The website may be down, or you may be experiencing issues with your Internet connection.
Check your Internet connection
Check any cables and reboot any routers, modems, or other network devices you may be using.
Allow Chrome to access the network in your firewall or antivirus settings.
If it is already listed as a program allowed to access the network, try removing it from the list and adding it again.
If you use a proxy server...
Check your proxy settings or contact your network administrator to make sure the proxy server is working. If you don't believe you should be using a proxy server: Go to the Chrome menu > Settings > Show advanced settings... > Change proxy settings... > LAN Settings and deselect "Use a proxy server for your LAN".
Error code: ERR_CONNECTION_TIMED_OUT

***SO What do i do now RIOT support?***

replies.body:
Aloha Zarroc,

Riot has been doing upgrades on their network to improve latency and some internet service providers haven't had their DNS cache update yet. This can be corrected by switching to a public DNS for now. Can you try following Riot's guide on changing to a public DNS service and see if it corrects your problems?
( [Windows Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq4) / [Mac Guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#mq3) \)
---
As I understand that you can't get to the support site so I will post all the instructions below:

> #Windows OS Instructions:
> **WINDOWS 8**
* Hit the Windows Key
* Type "Control Panel"
* Select "Network and Internet"
* Select "Network and Sharing Center"
* Select "Change Adapter Settings" on the navigation bar on the left
* Right click on your network adapter and select "Properties"
* Select "Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP/IPv4)" and open "Properties"
* Go to the bottom of the menu and change "Obtain DNS server address automatically," to "Use the following DNS server addresses:"
* Put in the following public DNS servers, one in each empty field:
 * 8.8.8.8 
 * 8.8.4.4
* Save your changes by selecting "Ok"
* Close all open web browsers and applications
* Hit the Windows Key
* Right click anywhere
* Click on "All Apps"
* Right click "Command Prompt" and run as administrator
* Type ipconfig /flushdns and press Enter.
* Restart your computer

> **WINDOWS 7**
* Open the Start Menu
* Open Control Panel
* Select "Network and Internet"
* Select "Network and Sharing Center"
* Select "Change Adapter Settings" on the navigation bar on the left
* Right click on your network adapter and select "Properties"
* Select "Internet Protocol Version 4 (TCP/IPv4)" and open Properties
* Go to the bottom of the menu and change 'Obtain DNS server address automatically,' to 'Use the following DNS server addresses:'
* Put in the following public DNS servers, one in each empty field:
 * 8.8.8.8 
 * 8.8.4.4
* Save your changes by selecting "Ok"
* Close all open web browsers and applications
* Press the Windows Key
* In the Search bar type command prompt
* Right click on the result and select Run as Administrator
* In the command prompt type ipconfig /flushdns and press Enter.
* Restart your computer

> **WINDOWS XP**
* Open the Start Menu
* Open Control Panel
* Open Network Connections
* Right click on your network adapter and select "Properties"
* Select "Internet Protocol (TCP/IP)" and open "Properties"
* Go to the bottom of the menu and change "Obtain DNS server address automatically,"to "Use the following DNS server addresses:"
* Put in the following public DNS servers, one in each empty field:
 * 8.8.8.8 
 * 8.8.4.4
* Save your changes by selecting "Ok"
* Close all open web browsers and applications
* Press the Windows Key
* In the Search bar type command prompt
* Right click on the result and select Run as Administrator
* In the command prompt type ipconfig /flushdns and press Enter.
* Restart your computer
---
> #Mac OS X Instructions:
> * Open System Preferences
* Open the Network preference pane
* Select the active connection on the left, and click the "Advanced..." button in the lower right hand corner
* Click "DNS" from the selection bar.
* Remove any current DNS entries, and input the following public DNS servers:
 * 8.8.8.8 
 * 8.8.4.4
* Save your changes by selecting "OK"
* Apply the changes by clicking "Apply" in the lower right hand corner

---
Let us know if it helps.

Kao is pretty spot on with this help!

These steps usually resolve these issues.  However, some players do not complete the final step of flushing their DNS.  This step is crucial as it will make sure that your computer uses the new DNS addresses instead of the old ones. For Windows users, make sure that you complete these steps after changing the DNS:

- Close all open web browsers and applications
- Press Win+R to open the Run menu
- Type "cmd" and press Enter to open the Command Prompt window
- Type “ipconfig /flushdns” and press Enter.
- Restart your computer
